data.name: Private Company Basics
data.text: Private companies are not publicly traded on stock exchanges. They are owned by a small group of individuals or entities. Private companies have more flexibility in decision-making and are not required to disclose financial information to the public.

questions.text: What is the main characteristic of a private company?
Who are the owners of private companies?

answers.text: Small group of individuals or entities

questions.text: Are private companies required to disclose financial information to the public?

data.name: Advantages of Private Companies
data.text: Private companies have more flexibility in decision-making and are not subject to the same regulatory requirements as public companies. They can focus on long-term goals without the pressure of meeting quarterly earnings targets. Additionally, private companies can maintain greater privacy and control over their operations.

questions.text: What is an advantage of private companies?
Why can private companies focus on long-term goals?

answers.text: No pressure to meet quarterly earnings targets

questions.text: Do private companies have more privacy and control over their operations?
